Tier 0 vehicles are the most basic and easiest to access. They don't require resources to be constructed, or research project to be researched, or neither. Tier 1 vehicles require a basic research project and a low resource cost in order to be constructed. They are inefficient, not ideal, have a lot of drawbacks, but they are cheap and available early in the game. Tier 2 vehicles are locked behind more specialised research projects and require resources that are only available later in the game. Tier 2 is considered to be the 'baseline' of all vehicles. Tier 3 vehicles are only obtainable if a specific condition is met - for example, they are first found in their wrecked form and restored. They require late game resources and generally serve a very specific purpose. Tier 4 vehicles are not able to be constructed by the player, but they can still be found, purchased or otherwise spawned. They generally represent technology beyond of what's achievable in the Rimworld setting.
